title: Josh Kroenke's reaction to Granit Xhaka shouting "f*** off" to Arsenal fans
text:

Josh Kroenke spoke to Unai Emery about Granit Xhaka's conduct in his office following Arsenal's 2-2 draw with Crystal Palace.

The Gunners director agreed with Emery that Xhaka was in the wrong on Sunday, and the duo discussed ways to manage the situation with the Switzerland international.

Xhaka was booed off the pitch against Palace and reacted by cupping his ears, swearing at fans, removing his Gunners shirt and storming down the tunnel.

He's yet to apologise to fans, despite his manager suggesting he does, and will play no part in Arsenal's Carabao Cup clash with Liverpool on Wednesday.

Emery is yet to confirm whether or not he will strip the midfielder's of the Arsenal captaincy, but confirmed Xhaka is "devastated" by the turn of events.

(Image: Arsenal FC via Getty Images)

Speaking about the issue on Tuesday, following an impromptu meeting with Kroenke, Emery said: "We are responsible, the club and I.

"We know our responsibility is to help everybody, and also when we are making some mistakes to recognise it.

(Image: Visionhaus)

"Sunday for example, after the match, Josh Kroenke was also in the dressing room speaking with me. We were speaking for 10 minutes about the situation but all the time helping each other.

"He's supporting me, he's supporting the players, we were talking about the circumstance with Granit Xhaka, saying that he was wrong and we need to manage that with him.

(Image: Arsenal FC via Getty Images)

"And yesterday the same, it was the day off for us and the players but we were here also, I was here and also I was speaking with Raul, with Edu, and also speaking with Xhaka.

"But now preparing the match tomorrow is the most important, but also we need the time managing different situations."
description: Unai Emery had an impromptu meeting with Josh Kroenke following Arsenal's 2-2 draw with Crystal Palace
